summary: This document is email correspondence between defense attorneys and a prosecutor regarding a filing in US v. Maxwell. The defense team disputes the government's representation about attempts to confer regarding photographs and requests clarification or correction. The correspondence includes references to sealed exhibits and a protective order.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. who sent the defense's letter response to the court regarding Rule 17 subpoena items and is copied on the prosecutor's email questioning representations about conferring.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding the Rule 17 submission and the dispute about attempts to confer with the government.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who is copied on the email correspondence regarding the court filing and the government's response.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding the Rule 17 submission dispute.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge Nathan (presumably Judge Alison J. Nathan) presiding over US v. Maxwell case, to whom the defense's letter response was addressed.

events.title: Defense letter regarding photographs
events.description: Defense team sent a letter to the government regarding particular photographs referenced in the case.

events.title: Defense response to Rule 17 submission
events.description: Defense filed a letter response to the government's submission on Rule 17 subpoena items 9-11, including sealed exhibits.

keyFacts: The defense team disputes the government's representation that they made multiple attempts to confer about photographs between May 6-12, 2021, claiming no such communications were received.
Exhibit B in the defense's filing was marked 'Confidential' by the government and filed under seal pursuant to a protective order.
The correspondence relates to US v. Maxwell case 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), indicating ongoing pretrial litigation regarding Rule 17 subpoena items.
The defense indicates they are prepared to file their response and exhibits on the public docket if directed by the court.
